Issues.Title: Trimming default solution for binding
Issues.Body:
Binding will not be supported as is in trimming. These changes explores the wider impact and is not meant to be merged. The final changes will achieve this in a different way.
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10991)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Trimming default solution for binding" (#10991)

Issues.Title: Any news on supporting custom languages?
Issues.Body:
### Environment

VS 17.9.2

### .NET version

.Net Framework 4.6 and later

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

This works with the internal form designer but not with the external form designer.

### Issue description

In ticket #8381 I asked about support for custom languages.
Is there any news on this?
To be clear: I do not want you to add support for a specific custom language, but I would like to restore the old situation where the form designer is language agnostic and gets driven by a code model that generates a (merged) CodeCompileUnit from the source files and generates the source files after the designer is finished from the updated CodeCompileUnit.
I can imagine that it may be difficult to send these objects between the IDE and the external designer, but it should not be too compilcated to serialize and deserialize the objects

### Steps to reproduce

- Configure VS to use the external designer
- Create a project with a custom language (like our X#)
- Create a windows forms item
- Open the designer
- Then the designer reports "The language for this file does not support the necessary code parsing and generation services. Please ensure the file you are opening is a member of a project and then try to open the file again. " This error message is misleading by the way. There is no problem with the language but with the external form designer. It should report 
"The external Windows Forms designer does not support the language for this project"

Issues.Title: TextBox height differs when adding in .NET core and in .NET framework project.
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Version 17.8.5

### .NET version

.NET Core 8.0 and .NET Framework 4.8

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

_No response_

### Issue description

When TextBox is dragged from the toolbox, the height of the TextBox control in .NET Core project differs from the .NET Framework project. In Core project, the height is 23 but in Framework project, the height is 20. Please refer to the attached samples.

In Framework sample:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/102359766/bf8342ec-f358-458f-9670-ccdc1ee9c401)

In Core sample:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/102359766/fb7b64b3-ba9b-42db-a141-e135d2d62f9f)

Samples:
[TextBox_NET_Framework.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/14483354/TextBox_NET_Framework.zip)
[TextBox_NET_Core.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/14483356/TextBox_NET_Core.zip)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Windows Forms Framework project.
2. Drag the TextBox control from the toolbox and note the height.
3. Create a Windows Forms Core project.
4. Drag the TextBox control from the toolbox and notice that the height is different from the Framework sample.


### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TextBox height differs when adding in .NET core and in .NET framework project." (#10989)

Issues.Title: WinForms designer does not work after migrating C++/CLI (managed) from net48 to net(core)70
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Windows 10

### .NET version

4.8, and >=7.0

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

_No response_

### Issue description

I try to migrate some C++/CLI (mixed/managed) projects from .net4.8 to net70

The problem is not the migration (I succeeded, it builds and run), the problem is the winforms designer.

Once my project is converted to net70, the winforms designer fails to load "Cannot load base class System.Windows.Forms.Form". Otherwise it builds and runs properly.



### Steps to reproduce

[https://chachatelier.fr/tmp/TestFromNetToNetCore.zip](https://chachatelier.fr/tmp/TestFromNetToNetCore.zip)

 Instructions :

- open the "TestFromNetToNetCore-net48-vs2022.sln" solution, build/run/open designer : it works
- open the "TestFromNetToNetCore-netcore70-vs2022.sln" solution, build/run:it works; open designer : it fails

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WinForms designer does not work after migrating C++/CLI (managed) from net48 to net(core)70" (#10988)

Issues.Title: An error occurred in the design interface after adding <PublishAot>true</PublishAot>
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9.0.100-preview.3.24128.12

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

It doesn't repro on .NET 7.0, repro from .NET 8.0 to .NET 9.0.

### Issue description

An error occurred in the design interface after adding <PublishAot>true</PublishAot> to the .csproj file

Call stack:
```

```

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/62ac4311-c81a-482f-9e74-56218398cad6

Expected result:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/e9635126-cd65-42ed-aa1a-09cc7fc3c817



### Steps to reproduce

1. Create Winforms .NET Core project
2. Close the Form.cs[Design] interface
3. Add the following code to the .csproj file: `<PublishAot>true</PublishAot>`
4. Save all
5. Double-click Form.cs in solution explorer to open the designer interface

**More info**:

1. The initial feedback ticket is: https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1977108
2. This problem also repro in VB projects
3. The error is different in .NET8.0 project

Issues.Title: [Proposal] Provide DarkMode Theming
Issues.Body:
Work in Progress.

- [x] New API for DarkMode control on Application.
- [x] New API for DarkMode control on Control.
- [x] Mapping SystemColors -> Application.SystemColors/patch for DarkMode
- [x] New API for controlling Form Titelbar Color/BorderColor/TextColor
- [x] Scrollbars for Form/ScrollableControl/ListView/TreeView/ListBox/ComboBox
- [x] Radio Button
- [x] CheckBox
- [x] ComboBox DarkMode
- [x] Button DarkMode
- [x] TreeView DarkMode
- [x] ListView DarkMode
- [x] TextBox/RichtextBox
- [x] Strips - Still have issues, but the basics work fine!
- [ ] Groupbox Caption
- [ ] ColumnHeaders ListView Forground Text
- [ ] ListView Forground Group Caption (might be an issue to get it brighter).
- [ ] TabControl (Scrollbars are working in DarkMode)
- [ ] MonthCalendar (We should have a new one altogether - that thing is a visual A11Y challenge.)
- [ ] DateTimePicker

Issues.Title: Update machine requirements
Issues.Body:
`Windows Media Player` and `Media Features` are required for building the full repo.

Without those Windows Features, the build fails with the following error:

`
C:\git\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\tests\AxHosts\AxHosts.Designer.cs(64,13): error CS0246: The type or namespace name 'AxWMPLib' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?) [C:\git\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\tests\AxHosts\AxHosts.csproj] [C:\git\winforms\src\BuildAssist\BuildAssist.msbuildproj]
`

## Proposed changes

- Update machine setup requirements with the list of Windows Features that are required for successful build.

Issues.Title: fix An exception popped up when click "Type Here" on ContextMenuStrip control in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9413 

## Root cause

The error is thrown in line 1585. MenuItem.Owner is null here.


https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/bd97476fa596ac2063153181daa6a46251dc755d/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/ToolStripMenuItemDesigner.cs#L1579-L1586

Actually , MenuItem.Owner is set in the method.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/bd97476fa596ac2063153181daa6a46251dc755d/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/ToolStripMenuItemDesigner.cs#L1640

We didn't bind this method to `ComponentChangeService`. It looks like a careless omission.

## Proposed changes

- 
- bind methods to `ComponentChangeService`
- 



## Screenshots 

### Before

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/4ae6cb77-9592-41ae-96df-65fe24d9241b

![menu-1](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/d9a6ef8a-76fc-4638-9ddd-8fa88128324f)

### After



https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/135201996/eb8502a2-5bc0-4526-833c-ff8b2e8b2a02



## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- 
- manually 
-

Issues.Title: [Multi-monitor] App window moves and resizes when second display disconnects
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

$ mono --version
Mono JIT compiler version 6.12.0.200 (tarball Tue Jul 11 21:37:50 UTC 2023)


### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

Disconnecting a second display causes a Mono app to translate and resize. It does not happen with other non-Mono applications and also not in non-Wayland environments.
The effect is not always the same. A test app in one environment resizes to different sizes (0,0) in another.

A mono trace of the occurrence:
[mono-trace.txt](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/14446034/mono-trace.txt)

It is currently not quite clear whether the event is handled incorrectly by mono, the XWayland layer or any of the deskop components.


### Steps to reproduce


Reproducable with the Weston compositor in [RebeccaBlackOS](https://sourceforge.net/projects/rebeccablackos/) live desktop

* Connect second display
* Run test app
* Disconnect second display
* App moves and resizes its window

Test source code:
```
using System.Windows.Forms;
 
public class TestApp : Form
{
    static public void Main ()
    {
        Application.Run (new Form());
    }
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Multi-monitor] App window moves and resizes when second display disconnects" (#10972)

Issues.Title: PrintPreviewDialog ToolStripButton's tooltip is last work item's after changing zoom's value
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9.0.100-preview.3.24128.12

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

It doesn't repro on .NET 6.0, repro from .NET 7.0 to .NET 9.0.

### Issue description

PrintPreviewDialog ToolStripButton's tooltip is last work item's after changing zoom's value

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create Winforms .NET Core project.
2. Add button, PrintDocument and PrintPreviewDialog controls.
3. Double click button and add below codes:
"printPreviewDialog.Document = myDocument;
 printPreviewDialog.ShowDialog();"
4. Run project.
5. Click button to open PrintPreviewDialog.
6. Tab through to Zoom and change zoom's value.
7. Continue to tab through all ToolStripButton's  and observe ToolStripButton's tooltip.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/130345015/ea28374c-ba7d-4e22-8f50-371be223d5eb

## Actual: 
All ToolStripButton's 's tooltip is correct.

## Expected: 
PrintPreviewDialog ToolStripButton's tooltip is last work item's.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "PrintPreviewDialog ToolStripButton's tooltip is last work item's after changing zoom's value" (#10970)

Issues.Title: Unnecessary duplication of filter pattern in System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog.Filter when not using wildcards
Issues.Body: ### .NET version 8.0.100 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? Not tested/verified ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? Same issue is present in .NET 7.0 ### Issue description The [Filter](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.filedialog.filter?view=windowsdesktop-8.0) property of the [System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.filedialog?view=windowsdesktop-8.0&viewFallbackFrom=net-8.0) class is supposed to accept a pipe-separated string containing description/pattern pairs, e.g. "Text files (\*.txt)" / "\*.txt". Pairs are also separated by pipe characters. A typical value for Filter would be "Text files (\*.txt)|\*.txt|All files (\*.\*)|\*.\*". At runtime, winforms uses this information to show items in the file dialog dropdown box so that the user can select a filter to apply. Using the sample filter string above, the dropdown displays as shown: As you can see, winforms shows each filter description for each line in the dropdown box. Now, if the filter descriptions do not include the filter pattern in parenthesis, winforms adds it automatically for you. For example, if you set Filter to "Text files|\*.txt|All files|\*.\*", the dropdown displays exactly as above. However, this fails when a filter pattern does not include wildcards (asterisks or question marks), but is made of just a file name. Consider the filter string "Databases (Database.db)|Database.db|All files (\*.\*)|\*.\*". This displays as follows: As you can see, the "Database.db" filter pattern is appended to the first item despite the fact that it is already included in the description. This should not happen. ### Steps to reproduce Create an instance of OpenFileDialog in code and then show it, as follows: ``` var dlg = new OpenFileDialog { Filter = "Databases (Database.db)|Database.db|All files (*.*)|*.*" }; dlg.ShowDialog(); ``` Since the Filter string includes a pair with no wildcards in its pattern, winforms appends the pattern to the description, causing unnecessary and cumbersome duplication.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unnecessary duplication of filter pattern in System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog.Filter when not using wildcards" (#10965)
